00:49 Introduction to CS50 and the approach to computer science 02:51 Understanding problem-solving in computer science 06:33 Understanding the pattern of binary numbers 08:35 Understanding binary representation and counting system. 12:30 ASCII code represents characters in binary form 14:31 Abstraction simplifies low-level details for better problem-solving. 18:36 Interpreting patterns of bits as images using RGB system 20:30 Understanding color representation in computers. 24:11 Efficiency of searching in phonebooks using different algorithms 25:48 Divide and conquer algorithm reduces problem size exponentially. 29:26 Pseudocode allows clear communication for humans and computers. 31:12 Functions, Conditions, and Loops are fundamental building blocks of programming. 34:33 Introduction to basic programming concepts using Scratch 36:42 Introduction to Scratch programming environment 40:02 Using Scratch to create interactive programs with user input and output 41:48 Understanding sound blocks and their behavior in Scratch 45:22 Introducing 'Count Zero' example showcasing variable usage and counting 47:14 Computers have finite capacity for storing information. 51:12 Understanding if-else conditional statements in Scratch 53:02 Simulation of walking using Scratch and quick photographs 56:41 Creating a program with multiple scripts and threads for parallel execution. 58:35 Integrating multiple scripts for interactive results 1:02:18 Using abstraction for more efficient coding 1:04:03 Creating custom puzzle pieces in Scratch 1:07:52 MC Hammer's iconic song 'U Can't Touch This' 1:09:35 Introduction to Computer Science through Scratch Crafted by Merlin AI.

@Anonymous Boy learn programming language you need for your purposes: game developing, Web, data sciences and eat. Then practice.

@RS-sx6ne  ok, first at all answer the question "what do I want to do with my knowledge of programming?". The answer may be: making a web sites or data analysis or games and get money from that(or something else). Then you Google what programming language you need for your purpose (c++, c#, lua, java, js for gamedev. python for data, machine learning and web programming. Php only for web, js for web). To learn any programming language I advise YouTube channel " the new boston". When you've learned syntaxes and bases, start practicing and working on some real project. And if you're good in English, you may get cs50 course before you start learning the language. Maybe you will not understand all concepts at first time, it's ok, don't give up. Return and repeat until you understand. Good luck
